results.title: A Short portrait of obsession
results.creator_credit: Jarrod Factor and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description:
A narrative about an artist who is torn between the film he is editing and the girl he loves.
Intriguing experimental piece with music soundtrack and no commentary - original music by Jarrod Factor.

results.title: A Short film on solar energy
results.creator_credit: Wild Wood Enterprises, Warner Communications, Saul Bass, Michael Britton and Elaine Bass
results.brief_description: A lighthearted film which uses animation to trace man’s use of energy through history to the oil shortage crises of the present, and the solutions solar power can offer. From the series “Consumer action now”.

results.title: A Short film about killing [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Zespoly Filmowe,Film Polski and Krzysztof Kieslowski
results.brief_description: This previously unreleased feature length of Kieslowski’s A Short Film About Killing is a film about killing, murder, a drifter and corporal punishment. The film seems as much about the polarities between the psychology of the murderer (representing perhaps the inner self or subconscious) and society (our conscious sense of the world) and our disconnection to it. Scenes from a drifter’s life are interspersed between those of a taxi driver who without reason is brutally murdered by the drifter. An unlawful crime is now in the hands of the law as the boy responsible faces the court and imminent sentencing, a legal death. Kieslowski does not try to explain the killer’s motivation but uses an unusual choreographed camera style to portray a disturbing disconnection between the drifter and the brutal murder of his victim. The light in the film is pulled from the edges of the frame to highlight the subject but also separate him visually from the outside world and his actions. As the court case proceeds we learn less about the motives of the killer and more of the cold morals of corporal punishment. The chilling parallels of the legal system and the unspoken psychology of the disconnected drifter are sealed with the verdict.ESC.

results.title: A Shopping expedition (K)
results.creator_credit: FilmFair Communications, Graham Clutterbuck and Ivor Wood
results.brief_description: Adapted from chapter 4 from the book “A Bear called Paddington” written by Michael Bond. Judy and Mrs Brown take Paddington to fashionable Barkridges’ department store to buy a pair of pyjamas. Although the store is having a big sale, Pyjama Week has been a disaster. After finding a pair of colourful pyjamas, Paddington enters what he believes to be a dressing room but which actually turns out to be the shop window. Fortunately his antics in the window make Pyjama Week a success and the grateful store manager makes Paddington a gift of anything he would like from the store. Narrated by Michael Hordern. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: A Shocking affair
results.brief_description: An animated illustration of the safety rule: “Never touch plumbing and electrical fixtures at the same time.” In the film we see a young woman commit the fatal error of switching on an electric light while in her bath. After a fleeting glimpse of a gravestone with the inscription R.I.P., we see her in the next world where in her celestial tub she is about to repeat her mistake but remembers the consequences just in time.

results.title: A Ship is born
results.brief_description: Offers an impressionistic view of shipbuilding and the baptismal launching of a ship, showing the relationship between man and his work. Shows the gaiety of the launching day contrasted with the tension of the workers, whose last job is to knock out the timber stills and send the ship down to the water.

results.title: A Ship comes to Antwerp
results.creator_credit: Greenpark Productions, British Petroleum and Humphrey Swingler
results.brief_description: Shows how the city of Antwerp is still dependent today on sea-borne traffic as it has been since the middle ages. Interwoven with the impression of the city is the arrival, docking, discharging, refuelling and departure of the freight ship ‘City of Karachi’. (Awards: Edinburgh Festival, 1953)

results.title: A Shifting Heart
results.brief_description: The 2nd Vatican Council, held in Rome in the 1960s, saw a massive restructuring of how Catholics approach their faith. For Australians this has meant a great deal of alteration in externals, for example the Mass today is spoken in English rather than Latin, - plus there has been a reassessment of the role of the individual Catholic in the modern world. The Roman Catholic faith has entered tumultuous times and few Catholics can idly stand by and watch the church disintegrate. However, there is an increasing mood among many Catholic lay people of assertiveness which promises well for the church’s future. Rated: G

results.title: A Shared table with Stephanie Alexander
results.creator_credit: December Films, On the Boil Productions, ABC-TV (Australia), Tony Wright, Stuart Menzies and John Smith
results.brief_description: This tape is a compilation of the seven part series screened on ABC TV which followed renowned chef Stephanie Alexander on a culinary journey across different regions of Australia. At each destination Stephanie, with the assistance of fellow chef Elena Bonnici, prepares a meal from local produce. By doing so she reveals the diversity of local producers, and the ease with which these ingredients can be incorporated into a delicious meal.
